intro: Galium ephedroides, commonly known as the redstem sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium ephedroides thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its growth habit is low and spreading, making it a common component of native plant communities.
